column74: THIS IS A PERFORMANCE BASED NON-PERSONAL ADVISORY AND ASSISTANCE SERVICES REQUIREMENT TO PROVIDE A UBO DATA ANALYST. THE CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE SHALL PROVIDE MEDICAL ADMINISTRATIVE, ANALYTICAL AND PROGRAMMATIC SUPPORT ON A WIDE ARRAY OF POLICY, PLANNING, ORGANIZATIONAL AND OPERATIONAL ISSUES THROUGH AFMOA, PORT SAN ANTONIO, TEXAS TO MAJCOM AND MTFS THROUGHOUT THE AFMS. THE UBO DA PROVIDES SUPPORT TO HEADQUARTERS STAFF AND 74 MEDICAL TREATMENT FACILITIES (MTFS) ON ALL ASPECTS OF BUSINESS AND FINANCIAL PLANS. THE GOVERNMENT WILL NEITHER SUPERVISE CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE NOR CONTROL THE METHOD BY WHICH THE CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE PERFORMS THE REQUIRED TASKS. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES SHALL THE GOVERNMENT ASSIGN TASKS TO, OR PREPARE WORK SCHEDULES FOR CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE. IT SHALL BE THE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE CONTRACTOR TO MANAGE ITS PERSONNEL AND TO GUARD AGAINST ANY ACTIONS THAT ARE PERSONAL SERVICES, OR GIVE THE PERCEPTION OF PERSONAL SERVICES. IF THE CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE FEELS ANY ACTIONS CONSTITUTE, OR ARE PERCEIVED TO CONSTITUTE PERSONAL SERVICES, NOTIFY THE CONTRACTING OFFICER IMMEDIATELY. THESE SERVICES SHALL NOT BE USED TO PERFORM WORK OF A POLICY/DECISION MAKING OR MANAGEMENT NATURE, I.E., INHERENTLY GOVERNMENTAL FUNCTIONS. ALL DECISIONS RELATIVE TO PROGRAMS SUPPORTED BY THE CONTRACTOR EMPLOYEE SHALL BE THE SOLE RESPONSIBILITY OF THE GOVERNMENT.
column86: YES - SERVICE WHERE PBA IS USED.

column137: ALL OTHER PROFESSIONAL, SCIENTIFIC, AND TECHNICAL SERVICES

column74: 2.0 SCOPE: THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE ALL PERSONNEL, ADMINISTRATION, AND MATERIALS REQUIRED TO SUPPORT THE ASW TEST, COMPARATIVE TEST, SSRNM, FORACS AND ASW RANGE PROGRAMS TO IMPROVE PERFORMANCE, QUALITY, TIMELINESS, AND EFFICIENCY THROUGHOUT THEIR PROGRAMS. AREAS OF SUPPORT INCLUDE: 2.1 STRATEGIC AND BUSINESS PLANNING, FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT ANALYSIS AND SUPPORT, PROGRAM MANAGEMENT, BUSINESS PROCESS REENGINEERING, ACQUISITION AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT, ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENTS, OVERALL SECURITY ASSESSMENT (INFORMATION, PHYSICAL AND INFRASTRUCTURE), AND PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT USING WIDELY AVAILABLE PROGRAM-COMPATIBLE TECHNOLOGY TOOLS. 2.2 THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE EXPERT ADVICE, ASSISTANCE AND GUIDANCE IN SUPPORT OF THE MANAGEMENT, ORGANIZATIONAL AND BUSINESS IMPROVEMENT. 3.0 REQUIREMENTS: HISTORICALLY, THIS TASK HAS BEEN SATISFIED WITH TWO MANYEARS OF SUPPORT ONE MANYEAR IN KEYPORT, WASHINGTON AND ONE MANYEAR IN WASHINGTON, DC. THE CONTRACTOR IS PROHIBITED FROM PARTICIPATING IN ANY CONTRACTUAL ACTIONS IDENTIFIED AS A RESULT OF ACTIVITIES SUPPORTED BY THIS TASK ORDER. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL PROVIDE SUPPORT SERVICES AS FOLLOWS: 3.1 STRATEGIC AND BUSINESS PLANNING: PROVIDE SUPPORT IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF STRATEGIC GOALS AND MEASURES OF EFFECTIVENESS AND IN THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROCESS ACTION TEAMS AND CONTINUOUS PROCESS IMPROVEMENT. THE CONTRACTOR SHALL DEVELOP PROGRAM METRICS THAT WILL GAUGE AND REPORT THE PROGRESS OF THE ASW TEST, COMPARATIVE TEST, SSRNM, FORACS AND ASW RANGE PROGRAMS STRATEGIC GOALS AND THEIR APPROACHES TO MEET THEM. THE FOCUS OF THIS EFFORT WILL BE FOR THE CONTRACTOR TO: CONTINUE WITH ONGOING INITIATIVES SUCH AS THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A BALANCED SCORECARD (BSC) METHODOLOGY; ASSIST WITH DRAFTING THE FRAMEWORK OF THE BSC; LEAD AND FACILITATE WORKING GROUP SESSIONS; AND OTHER EFFORTS AS NECESSARY TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF STRATEGIC PLANS. 3.2 FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT ANALYSIS AND SUPPORT: ASSIST IN THE PREPARATION OF NAVCOMPT, OFFICE OF THE SECRETARY OF DEFENSE (OSD), AND CONGRESSIONAL BUDGETS IN ACCORDANCE WITH NAVCOMPT AND DOD INSTRUCTIONS. ASSIST IN THE PREPARATION AND REVIEW OF THE PROGRAM OBJECT MEMORANDUM (POM) PROCESS. SUPPORT THE PREPARATION AND INCORPORATION OF COST ESTIMATES INTO BUDGET PLANNING ESTIMATES. ASSIST IN THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM OFFICE S DEFENSE OF ITS BUDGETS: 3.2.1 RESPOND TO NAVCOMPT AND OSD BUDGET REVIEW QUESTIONS 3.2.2 PREPARE RECLAMAS TO BUDGET MARKS, 3.2.3 WRITE ISSUE PAPERS, 3.2.4 RESPOND TO CONGRESSIONAL REQUESTS FOR INFORMATION, AND 3.2.5 PREPARE BRIEFINGS TO HIGHER AUTHORITIES. 3.2.6 PREPARE MONTHLY BUDGET AND EXECUTION REPORTS AND PRESENT AT MONTHLY REVIEWS. 3.3 PROGRAM MANAGEMENT: SUPPORT THE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT FUNCTION OF THE PROGRAM MANAGER BY PROVIDING SYSTEMATIC APPROACHES TO RESOURCE PLANNING AND ALLOCATION. ASSIST IN THE SEMI-ANNUAL REVIEW OF PROGRAM PROGRESSES RELATIVE TO FUNDING AND ESTABLISHED PROGRAM PLANS/BUDGETS. PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS/ALTERNATIVES TO ACHIEVE PROGRAM OBJECTIVES. ASSIST IN PROVIDING FINANCIAL ANALYSIS RELATING TO NAVY COMPTROLLER OFFICE (NAVCOMPT), DEPARTMENT OF DEFENSE (DOD), AND CONGRESSIONAL INQUIRIES AND REVIEWS. AGGREGATE, ANALYZE, AND ORGANIZE PROGRAM ACTIVITY INFORMATION INTO PROGRAM STATUS SUMMARIES AND OVERVIEWS USING APPROVED IT TECHNOLOGY. 3.4 BUSINESS PROCESS REENGINEERING: CONTINUE THE PROGRAM S RE-ENGINEERING AND BENCHMARKING EFFORTS AS REVIEWED DURING SEMI-ANNUAL MEETINGS. PROVIDE INPUT AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR WORKFLOW ANALYSIS AND CONTINUOUS PROCESS IMPROVEMENT. 3.5 ACQUISITION AND PROJECT MANAGEMENT: PROVIDE ASSISTANCE IN REQUIREMENTS ANALYSIS AND DETERMINATION, ACQUISITION PLANNING, TECHNICAL AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT SUPPORT, PROGRAM BASE LINING, PROGRAM CONTROL, PROGRAM REPORTING, AND RISK MANAGEMENT.
column86: NO - SERVICE WHERE PBA IS NOT USED.
column137: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES

column137: ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT AND GENERAL MANAGEMENT CONSULTING SERVICES

column74: THE PROJECT SUPPORT BRANCH (PSB) IS STENNIS SPACE CENTERS (SSC) FOCAL POINT FOR ENSURING THAT LONG-RANGE OPERATING PROGRAM OBJECTIVES ARE MET BY MONITORING BUDGET FORMULATION, ALLOCATION, EXECUTION AND PROGRAM CONTROL ELEMENTS. IN KEEPING WITH THIS ASSIGNMENT THE PSB ASSISTS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROGRAM PROJECT PLANS, MAINTAINS PARAMETRIC COST/PERFORMANCE DATABASES AND PERFORMS RIGOROUS COST BENEFIT ANALYSIS. THESE EFFORTS ARE IN KEEPING WITH THE DEVELOPMENT OF A STRATEGIC PLANNING FRAMEWORK TO ALIGN SSCS INVESTMENT STRATEGIES WITH THE LONG-TERM VISION AND PERFORMANCE REQUIREMENTS OF THE AGENCY. THIS PROPOSAL IS INTENDED TO OUTLINE A SYSTEMATIC APPROACH OF RESEARCH AND ANALYSIS WHICH BEST SUPPORTS STENNIS SPACE CENTER S GOALS AS WELL AS THOSE OF NASA. 2.0 BACKGROUND THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI (USM) IS A COMPREHENSIVE RESEARCH INSTITUTION OF HIGHER LEARNING WHOSE PRIMARY MISSION IS TO PROMOTE INTELLECTUAL DEVELOPMENT AND FOSTER CREATIVE THINKING. AS A MEMBER OF THE MISSISSIPPI RESEARCH CONSORTIUM (MRC), USM PROVIDES RESEARCH ASSISTANCE AND TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO STENNIS SPACE CENTER. FOR MORE THAN A DECADE USM HAS PROVIDED ONGOING SUPPORT AND TECHNICAL SERVICES TO THE INNOVATIVE PARTNERSHIP PROGRAM AS WELL AS THE PROJECT SUPPORT BRANCH. THIS LONG STANDING RELATIONSHIP HAS PROVIDED THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI WITH UNIQUE INSIGHT INTO SSCS MANAGEMENT, OPERATIONS AND ENVIRONMENT. UTILIZING AN INDEPENDENT TEAM, IN A NON-COMPETITIVE POSTURE, USMS PSB GROUP HAS PROVIDED UNBIASED ASSESSMENT OF NASA RESOURCES, ON SITE CONTRACTOR PERFORMANCE AND EXTERNAL SERVICE PROVIDERS. AS A RESULT THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI IS UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO FULFILL THE TASKS OUTLINED BY THIS STATEMENT OF WORK. 3.0 TASKS THE FOLLOWING DESCRIBES USMS RESPONSE TO THE SPECIFIC TASKS AND DELIVERABLES IDENTIFIED WITHIN NASAS STATEMENT OF WORK. THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MISSISSIPPI INTENDS TO UTILIZE A TEAM OF EXPERIENCED INDIVIDUALS FAMILIAR WITH NASA S VISION FOR SPACE EXPLORATION AS WELL AS SSCS MISSION TO SUPPORT THOSE GOALS. USM WILL UTILIZE CURRENT IN PLACE FINANCIAL REPORTING SYSTEMS AS WELL AS SPECIALIZED TOOLS TO MEASURE FINANCIAL AND PERFORMANCE DATA AS IT RELATES TO CURRENT YEAR PROJECT/PROGRAM PLANS. TASK 1: PROVIDE A HIGH LEVEL REVIEW AND ANALYSIS OF STRATEGIC PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS AS IT RELATES TO LONG-RANGE IMPLEMENTATION PLANNING FOR THE SSC MISSION PROJECTS. IDENTIFY REQUISITE TOOLS AND PROCESSES NEEDED TO SUPPORT THESE ACTIVITIES. TASK 2: ANALYZE AND IDENTIFY THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN PROJECTED MAJOR PROGRAM CHANGES AND SSC PROJECTED BUDGET. FORECAST SHORTFALLS AND ACTIONS NECESSARY TO ACCOMMODATE THE CHANGES. EVALUATE THE EFFECT OF COST AND PROGRAM CHANGES ON THE BUDGET EXECUTION PROCESS. TASK 3: REVIEW AND ANALYZE A BROAD BASE OF HISTORICAL DATA AND CURRENT TRENDS TO VALIDATE AND CONSOLIDATE REQUESTS AND ESTIMATES FOR AN INTEGRATED BUDGET FOR A MAJOR MULTI-FUNCTIONAL PROGRAM. RESOLVE COMPLEX PROBLEMS OF PREDICTION AND FORECASTING WHICH RESULT FROM UNCERTAINTIES OR CHANGES IN OPERATING PROGRAMS, AND FOR DETERMINING THE PROPRIETY OF SYSTEMS AND METHODS USED BY OPERATING OFFICIALS IN DEVELOPING ESTIMATES FOR FUNDING REQUIREMENTS. TASK 4: IDENTIFY AND UTILIZE REQUISITE CRITERIA TO MEASURE AND/OR PREDICT THE ATTAINMENT OF PROGRAM OR ORGANIZATIONAL GOALS AND OBJECTIVES WHICH CONTRIBUTE TO THE IMPROVEMENT OF PRODUCTIVITY, EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICIENCY IN PROGRAM OPERATIONS AND/OR ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT ACTIVITIES AT DIFFERENT ECHELONS AND/OR GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATIONS WITHIN THE ORGANIZATION. TASK 5: PERFORM AN ANALYSIS ON THE POTENTIAL ECONOMIC IMPACTS OF SSCS ALIGNMENT WITH PRESENT DAY AGENCY GOALS AND DIRECTION. DELIVERABLES: MONTHLY VALIDATION OF RAW DATA FROM NASAS FINANCIAL TOOLS; SAP, OAC AND THE PROJECT FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT DATABASE 2ND BUSINESS DAY AFTER FINANCIAL MONTH END.
